comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

1. Turn on hardware acceleration.  Tools-->Options-->Advanced
2. Open a new browser windows.  Ctrl+N.
3. Go to page http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=650PU49u1BE
4. Move the mouse around the page and notice the flashing of all components.
5. Turn off hardware acceleration.
6. Open a new browser window. (Important to make sure window isn't using acceleration).
7. Go to page http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=650PU49u1BE
8. Move the mouse around the page and notice that there is no flashing.



Actual results:

Evidently something is wrong with the hardware accelerated rending of certain pages (lots of them, possibly all) when using Firefox 7 on Windows XP SP3 x32 with Direct X 9.0c.

I have not seen this on Windows 7 with Direct X 10.  These are the only two configurations that I have tested.


Expected results:

No flashing a blank content area of the browser window.

The workaround is to turn off hardware acceleration.  However, the change only seems to take affect in newly opened windows.
